host_about:
Bienvenidos al mundo de Marga Casanova! Soy Marga, diseñadora de interiores, española nacida en Madrid. Mi trayectoria comenzó con el diseño y distribución de textil hogar, que siempre esta muy presente en mis proyectos. Otra parte importante en mis obras son las tapicerías  herencia de mi abuelo propietario de una de las mejores empresas del sector en los años 60.
Me encanta viajar, tengo grandes amigos en Portugal, Bélgica e Italia…donde me siento como en casa. Así me gustaría recibir a mis nuevos huéspedes en Madrid Boutique Suites: cinco apartamentos vacacionales diseñados con elegancia clásica y elementos de diseño puntuales. Todo un eclecticismo reflejo de un Madrid cultural, elegante y moderno a su vez. Situados en la mejor ubicación posible, justo en la puerta del Sol, centro neurálgico de la ciudad. 
Con una comunicación abierta y plena confianza,te atenderemos personalmente para un feliz hospedaje  en Madrid. 
Airbnb nos hace llegar hasta ti para que sueñes tu estancia con  las mejores fotos profesionales de  nuestros espacios Marga Casanova!!!
Welcome to Marga Casanova´s world! I am Marga, an interior designer, Spanish, born in Madrid My career began with the design and distribution of home textiles, which is always present in my projects. Another important part of my works are the fabric an heritage of my grandfather, the  owner of one of the best companies of the sector in the 60s.
I love traveling, I have great friends in Portugal, Belgium and Italy ... where I feel at home. So I would like to wellcome my new hosters  at Madrid  Boutique Suites:, four vacacional rental  designed with classic elegance and specific design elements. Eclectic atmophere which reflects a cultural ,elegant and modern Madrid, at the same time. Located in the best possible location, right on Puerta del Sol, the heart of the city.
With an open comunication and the confident that the guest will enjoyed, We will personally attend you to a happy stay in Madrid.
Airbnb makes us come to you to dream your stay with the best professional photos of our spaces Marga Casanova!

name: Balcony double/twin room in stylish Salamanca area
description: Contemporary and elegant rooms with balcony overlooking Recoletos Boulevard. These rooms feature desks, Smart TV 46”, high profile extra-comfort mattress and spacious rain shower, bathrobe and slippers. These rooms have 23m2 with one king size bed (1.80m) or two twin beds (0.90m). Safe tourism certified hotel
neighborhood_overview:
One Shot Recoletos 04 is located on Calle Salustiano Olózaga, in the heart of Salamanca district in Madrid, a central point in the city and one of the most exclusive neighbourhoods in the whole of Europe.

The hotel is just a 5-minute walk from the National Library, Plaza de Cibeles and El Retiro and a 10-15 minute walk from Madrid’s three great art museums: El Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza and Reina Sofía.

Salamanca district has the highest concentration of luxury brands in Madrid, gathered around the streets of Serrano, Ortega y Gasset, Claudio Coello, Lagasca and Ayala, where you can find many fashion, decoration and jewellery boutiques.

Salamanca district is an excellent destination for lovers of fine cuisine thanks to its many restaurants, gastronomic markets, bars and terraces, among which there are several Michelin-starred restaurants.
host_about: One Shot Recoletos 04 is a 4-star boutique hotel located in the exclusive Salamanca district in Madrid, between Puerta de Alcalá and Paseo de Recoletos. Its Neoclassical façade, made by the architect Manuel Aníbal Álvarez, is a classic example of local Nineteenth-century architecture whereas its interior is characterised by the presence of contemporary works of art, furniture and designer items, thus creating a highly unique atmosphere where our guests can enjoy a special and unforgettable stay.

description:
This beautiful three-story apartment with high ceilings and bright ceilings is ideal for staying a few days and getting to know Madrid. A vaulted room and a living room with a large and very comfortable sofa bed.
In addition, a chillout area on the second floor and on the third a terrace with nice views south of Madrid.
neighborhood_overview:
Ambassadors-Lavapiés is one of the downtown neighborhoods of Madrid. Newly rated as the coolest neighborhood in the world!
Its proximity to Tirso de Molina, Antón Martín or the Reina Sofía Museum make it a strategic place.
The metro that connects Lavapiés with Puerta del Sol in just 5 minutes, is just 150 meters from home.
It is a lively neighborhood, many events and many establishments such as clothing stores, countless bars and restaurants of all kinds. However, the apartment is very quiet to be a fourth floor and have good windows that isolate.
The Mercado de Antón Martín is one of the best in the city and is a 5-minute walk away.
The arrival is very comfortable, since Atocha is very close to the apartment to be able to walk

description: Welcome to our home in Madrid! We offer you unrestricted access to our home. You will enjoy a spacious bedroom with an en-suite shower room on the ground floor with access to a patio.
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is located in the Parque Conde de Orgaz, which is an upscale residential area just outside Madrid's M30 (inner ring road), in the northwest of Madrid, very close to Madrid Barajas Airport (MAD).

name: Encantadora habitación en Madrid
description: Charming room in Lavapiés, located in the center of Madrid. It is fully equipped with a single bed (90x190), a desk with a chair and a lamp and a closet. neighborhood_overview:
Lavapiés is a multicultural neighborhood full of theaters, alternative bookstores, bars and art galleries.

It is now being embraced for its edgy culture, diverse cuisine and alternative nightlife. Just one stop from Sol, Lavapiés is the perfect place to check out Madrid’s changing personality, especially for its amazing Indian restaurants.

Walking down calle Argumosa you can find authentic bars and tantalising outdoor seating areas. It stretches right to Atocha Street behind the Reina Sofia Museum.

name: Contemporary double/twin room next to Retiro Park
description: Elegant and comfortable rooms with modern design, desk, Smart TV 46”, high profile extra-comfort mattress and spacious rain shower. These rooms overlook the hotel's courtyard. These rooms have 19m2 with one king size bed (1.80m) or two twin beds (0.90m)
neighborhood_overview:
One Shot Recoletos 04 is located on Calle Salustiano Olózaga, in the heart of Salamanca district in Madrid, a central point in the city and one of the most exclusive neighbourhoods in the whole of Europe.

The hotel is just a 5-minute walk from the National Library, Plaza de Cibeles and El Retiro and a 10-15 minute walk from Madrid’s three great art museums: El Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza and Reina Sofía.

Salamanca district has the highest concentration of luxury brands in Madrid, gathered around the streets of Serrano, Ortega y Gasset, Claudio Coello, Lagasca and Ayala, where you can find many fashion, decoration and jewellery boutiques.

Salamanca district is an excellent destination for lovers of fine cuisine thanks to its many restaurants, gastronomic markets, bars and terraces, among which there are several Michelin-starred restaurants.
host_about: One Shot Recoletos 04 is a 4-star boutique hotel located in the exclusive Salamanca district in Madrid, between Puerta de Alcalá and Paseo de Recoletos. Its Neoclassical façade, made by the architect Manuel Aníbal Álvarez, is a classic example of local Nineteenth-century architecture whereas its interior is characterised by the presence of contemporary works of art, furniture and designer items, thus creating a highly unique atmosphere where our guests can enjoy a special and unforgettable stay.

name: NICE & BIG DOUBLE ROOM AT DOWNTOWN
host_about:
Soy David español, amable, simpático y con buena energía. No fumo,  limpio y me gusta mantener la casa lo más bonita que podamos para sentirme en mi refugio y ofrecer algo lindo a las personas. me gusta recorrer el mundo y conocer la historia de los lugares a los q voy , recorrer sus calles, descubrir sus secretos pero, sobre todo, conocer la gente y el día a día de quienes los habitan. Con Airbnb tengo bastante experiencia y me parece una forma fenomenal de viajar y compartir. 
me gusta salir a pasear, ir al teatro, a musicales, a conciertos, tomar fotografías y ver películas y documentales.

name: A room on the river
description:
A very spacious and comfortable private room on the river bank of Madrid. There's a dedicated working space in the room, and in the house there’s a big bath (with bathtub) and a specious living room with a beautiful balcony facing the river.
The guests have access to all the house facilities (shared with me and my wife).
The house is equipped with everything needed for a comfortable and quiet stay in Madrid.
neighborhood_overview:
A very quiet and safe neighborhood and yet, very well connected. The apartment is 20 minutes walk from the old center of Madrid (La Latina neighborhood) and only 10-15 minutes by bus from Plaza de España, Plaza Mayor and any other central location in the city.
The neighborhood is a real Madrillian neighborhood, with tradicional cheap Madrillian bars and local families.
The river bank is a beautiful promenade with a lot of greenery and playgrounds for children.
It is the perfect location if you are looking to stay close to everything going on in the center but still maintain the quietness and authenticity of a non-touristic area.

La Latina-Tirso de Molina is one of the most deeply rooted historic areas of Madrid. neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of Madrid is Malasaña, the youngest and most creative part of the city, where tradition and the cutting edge live in perfect harmony. Gastronomy, shopping, art, culture and nightlife: entertainment in Malasaña is guaranteed.

Beyond the typical tourist routes of the city, Malasaña is one of the most rapidly changing areas of the city. More than 200 years old, the ‘barrio’ takes its name from a seamstress murdered during the French occupation during the uprising of 2nd May 1808. In the 1980’s, it became the epicentre of the famous ‘movida madrileña’ and has not stopped evolving since then, so much so that every time you go there you seem to find something new. Nowadays it’s considered the hipster district, with its own way of life and unique atmosphere. Ordinary, everyday bars and traditional shops sit side by side in perfect harmony with the latest trends, fashionable hang-outs and an endless array of alternative cultural offerings.

The best way to get

description:
Barrio de las Letras.
Cozy renovated apartment on Calle Cervantes in a historical building. Located in the middle of Madrid 5 minutes from Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor and 3 minutes from Museo del Prado, Thyssen Museum.
Very quiet street with supermarket next door and a lot of bars and shops.
New refurnished Apartment in the heart of Madrid. Only 3 minutes walk to main tourists areas: Museums, City Centre, Restaurants & bars
Quiet street with good access metro & Bus.
neighborhood_overview:
Where your feet feel the literature...
Have you ever walked through book fragments? Have you dreamed of being a part or the protagonist of a novel? If your answer is yes, go into the surprising Barrio de las Letras.
Don't be in a hurry, let yourself be carried away by the literature printed in a beautiful golden color. Feel the Spanish Golden Age at every step, on every corner, on every wall.
Modern shops, design shops, other "all life" stores, convents, palaces, luxury hotels, tasks, taverns, restaurants, museums, squares, plazas and a succession of streets where Madrid gives us its history, culture, cuisine and, of course, its letters!
Perfectly delimited between the famous streets of Atocha, Carrera de San Jerónimo and Paseo del Prado and closing the almost perfect triangle, Calle Carretas. Immerse yourself in the Barrio de las Letras is immersed in the living history of the Spanish Golden Century. Sometimes you can hear a work of Lope de Vega whispering among th

description:
Welcome to our home in Madrid! We offer you unrestricted access to our home in a quiet residential area.
You will enjoy a spacious luxury home, composed of 2 double bedrooms, 1 twin bedroom, and 2 single bedrooms (with child decor).
The house is fully equipped and has enhanced security (zoned alarms and security cameras) and ample private parking space.
The rental price includes the services of a private chef, a private butler, and housekeeping staff.
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is located in the Parque Conde de Orgaz, which is an upscale residential area just outside Madrid's M30 (inner ring road), in the northwest of Madrid, very close to Madrid Barajas Airport (MAD) and Wanda Metropolitano football stadium, home to the 2019 UEFA Champions League Final.
It has a security service, with patrols circulating 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
The nearest metro line is line 4 (stations Arturo Soria and Esperanza), with which you can access the center of Madrid in about 20 minutes.

neighborhood_overview:
Description of the Zone : Nuevos Ministerios

The Nuevos Ministerios Area is located between the districts of Chamberí and Tetuan. The zone combine tradicional constructions tipical of XIX Century with modern and sofisticated architecture. Between Paseo de la Castellana main Avenue of the City, and Calle Orense, -in the complex of Azca-, that was designed in the years 70, with the intention to create a modern financial and business center for the epoch. Located in the centre of Nuevos Ministerios are some symbolic skyscrapers of Madrid: the Tower Picasso and the Tower Europe. In the zone there are bars oriented towards executives, with a lot of Clubs, Pubs and Dicoteques to choice for nightlife. This is a zone of great financial activity, and is the choice location for the offices of multinational corporations and the most important financial institions both Spanish and Foreign. Here you will find Ministeries Offices and also numerous embassies. Also in the zone there

name: Habitación luminosa centro ciudad
description:
Spacious and bright outdoor room with wardrobe, for a responsible and orderly person. Located between Almudena Cathedral and Madrid Rio. Close to Prince Pio, very well connected.
Close to historic parks. 4th floor, elevator.
neighborhood_overview: Imperial Quarter, next to the Centre and Palace. It is a neighborhood of the 1930s nestled in the lower part of the hill of Vistillas and the Cathedral of Almudena and surrounded by the Park of Athens and the Campo del Moro and Madrid Rio. Google's Madrid Campus has recently been installed on the block next door. It is a family neighborhood with many bars and supermarkets and very well connected with the rest of Madrid as well as with its exits because it is next to the M-30 and the nearby Príncipe Pio station (metro, buses and commuter train). Also in this complex, there is a shopping center (Warner) with many shops and cinemas.
host_about: Me gusta charlar y saber de las costumbres de otras regiones o países. Me gustan los idiomas, la música y el deporte (y Madrid...). Tengo en casa una colección de CD´s musicales, de mapas y DVD´s de películas, así como biblioteca.

name: Justicia Centro Gran Vía Home.
description:
Bright and comfortable double bedroom, with unique 70´s decoration. Located in the heart of the city center, between Gran Vía, Malasaña, Chueca y Alonso Martinez.

The best area to eat and take out by night
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is between the neighborhoods Malasaña, Chueca y Gran Vía,

CHUECA: is a square sited in a central neighbourhood in Madrid named Justicia. It lies just to the north of the old city, with its metro station "Chueca." is very lively, with many street cafes and boutique shops.

MALASAÑA is surrounded by several metro stations and is a central neighbourhood of Madrid.
it was the center of the movida movement in late 1970s and 1980s Madrid.
Night life venues in the area include La Vía Láctea, Penta, Diplodocus, Nueva Visión, La Vaca Austera, and El Barco. Templo de Susu is a high-end retro clothing shop. Very bohemian cafes include Pepe Botella, La Paca, La Ida and Lolina Vintage Café. An American book shop and bar (J & J's Books and Coffee) sits on Calle Espíritu Santo near the Noviciado metro station.

Bright room with single balcony and large closet in charming apartment, in the middle of downtown Madrid. In the vibrant neighborhood of La Latina, a few minutes from the metro, 10 minutes walk to Plaza Mayor, Royal Palace, San Miguel Market and 15 minutes to Sol.

Very central and well located, the neighborhood is ideal for tapas and cañas, theaters, cinemas, and walking to Plaza de España, Templo de Debod, Gran Vía, Parque del Retiro, Madrid Rio, the main museums and local markets.

The La Latina neighborhood is very vibrant and is right in the center of Madrid. It is one of the favorite areas of Madrid locals and tourists to enjoy cañas, tapas and the cultural life of the city because it is full of good bars, restaurants, theatres, and places of interest to visit within a few minutes walk.

The apartment has an excellent location and you can visit on foot, from only 3 to 30 minutes, depending on what you choose:

- Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real, Mercado de San Miguel, Sol, Parque del Retiro, Gran Vía, Museo Reina Sofia, Museo del Prado, Plaza de España, Templo de Debod, Mercado de la Cebada, Basilica de San Franciso, Basilica de la Almudena, Opera, El Rastro, Mercado de San Fernando, Mercado de Antón Martín, Madrid Rio, Puerta de Toledo, and much more...

Open tall wooden shutters and let morning light stream into a room with exposed timber framing and whitewashed brick walls reaching to high ceilings. Have breakfast in a cheerful open space at a sunny table in front of an elegant fireplace.

I have several apartments in Madrid, but this is the latest one I have decorated, paying close attention to detail. I have truly tried to make it as comfortable as possible for my guests. It has lots of light and it's beautiful.
If one were to read my reviews they would notice that I care a lot for my guests, I am always readily available, and I try my best to make them feel at home when they are in Madrid.

You will have the whole apartment.

We will be there in person to meet you, and give you the keys. After you book, I give you my number and you can text or call if needed.

host_about: I have lived in Madrid with my family since 2000. We travel a lot and like to stay at apartments ourselves. It makes you feel like you live in that city. I speak several languages and enjoy meeting people from all over the world. It will be my pleasure to host you in Madrid.

neighborhood_overview:
Situated in Austrias, the historic neighbourhood of Madrid, here you will find the best points of interest of the City, such as the Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor, Puerta de Sol, various historic churches and the impressive Cathedral of Almudena.
In addition, the neighbourhood is full of beautiful buildings and stunning arcitecture.
Around the the apartment, you will find the best bars and restaurants such as Botin (the oldest restaurant in the World) or Casa Lucio (World famous for it's Egg dishes very typical here in Spain). Also, you will find, Mercado de San Miguel, Plaza de La Paja o Caba Baja, excellent places to sample some of the best Tapas in the Capital.
Each Sunday you can talk a stroll down the famous Rastro Market to buy antiques, paintings or simply just enjoy the ambience.
Also in the neighbourhood there are numerous cinemas and theatres, shopping centres with the best shops to treat yourself.

neighborhood_overview:
One Shot Recoletos 04 is located on Calle Salustiano Olózaga, in the heart of Salamanca district in Madrid, a central point in the city and one of the most exclusive neighbourhoods in the whole of Europe.

The hotel is just a 5-minute walk from the National Library, Plaza de Cibeles and El Retiro and a 10-15 minute walk from Madrid’s three great art museums: El Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza and Reina Sofía.

Salamanca district has the highest concentration of luxury brands in Madrid, gathered around the streets of Serrano, Ortega y Gasset, Claudio Coello, Lagasca and Ayala, where you can find many fashion, decoration and jewellery boutiques.

Salamanca district is an excellent destination for lovers of fine cuisine thanks to its many restaurants, gastronomic markets, bars and terraces, among which there are several Michelin-starred restaurants.
host_about: One Shot Recoletos 04 is a 4-star boutique hotel located in the exclusive Salamanca district in Madrid, between Puerta de Alcalá and Paseo de Recoletos. Its Neoclassical façade, made by the architect Manuel Aníbal Álvarez, is a classic example of local Nineteenth-century architecture whereas its interior is characterised by the presence of contemporary works of art, furniture and designer items, thus creating a highly unique atmosphere where our guests can enjoy a special and unforgettable stay.

host_about: aMe llamo Ángel y soy un chico de 30 años que vive en Madrid desde hace 3. Soy Ingeniero en Telecomunicaciones y trabajo desarrollando software y también soy Músico (percusionista). Nos hemos encontrado esta preciosa casa en el barrio de Lavapiés y queremos probar a compartirla esporádicamente por AirBnB para conocer gente interesante (músicos + 3 puntos) y financiarla un poco.... Valoramos mucho una buena convivencia, que cada uno desarrolle si vida en la casa como prefiera siempre que no moleste al resto. Y nada más... Si estás pensando venir a Madrid creo que esta es la mejor opción para alojarte...:)

name: Apartamento para 4 en el Distrito Gastronómico
description: Spacious loft located in representative building from the early 20th century,  completely renovated. Located  in the heart of the Barrio de Salamanca (one of Madrid's best shopping and leisure areas) and just five minutes away from Parque del Retiro and Puerta de Alcalá. The house has a spacious living room, kitchen, guest toilet and two bedrooms, each with its own bathroom and dressing room.
neighborhood_overview:
In the surrounding area you will find a wide variety of good restaurants as well as the best shops and boutiques in the city.
The house, located between Alcalá and Goya streets, is very close to the commercial axis formed by Serrano, Goya and Ortega y Gasset streets; the business centers of the capital, as well as the most important cultural tours of Madrid (Museo del Prado, Fundación Thyssen, Puerta de Alcalá..). The Retiro Park is less than 5 minutes walk from the house.
host_about:
El desarrollo sostenible, la recuperación del patrimonio y el respeto a los valores culturales de nuestra sociedad, son algunas de las señas de identidad de Innduomo Property Management.
Defendemos un estilo propio, muy personal, con una relación cercana a los huéspedes que se alojan en nuestras casas, para ofrecerles una estancia con todas las comodidades de los pequeños hoteles con encanto, pero con la flexibilidad y libertad que sólo puede alcanzarse en localizaciones excepcionales.

name: Elegant room next to Retiro Park & WiZink
description:
Enjoy a lovely stay in a private room in an elegant flat in the heart of Retiro, Madrid. Located at a 5 mins walk from Retiro Park and WiZink Center and on the famous Ibiza street of Madrid, this apartment is the stopover you need when visiting Madrid.
The room includes a private washroom and access to the facilities. All of Madrid is accessible by the bus and metro stops at a 3 mins walk from the apartment. Whether you are looking for peace or an adventure, you'll find it.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the vibrant and eclectic Ibiza neighborhood in Madrid! Nestled in the heart of the Spanish capital, this lively district offers a taste of the Mediterranean right in the city center. With its charming narrow streets, colorful facades, and bustling local markets, Ibiza exudes an authentic Spanish atmosphere that will enchant any traveler.

You'll find yourself surrounded by an array of delightful tapas bars, where you can savor the finest Spanish cuisine and sip on Sangria as you soak in the local culture. During the day, explore the nearby Retiro Park or take a leisurely stroll to the Reina Sofia Museum to admire world-class art.

Some personal favourite restaurants on Ibiza street are:
1. Bulebar (Spanish cuisine)
2. Mercado de Ibiza (Spanish fusion cuisine)
3. District Burger (Hamburgers)
4. La indigna (Spanish tapas)
5. Sibuya (Japanese fusion)
6. Goiku (Hamburgers)

name: Habitación en piso moderno, acogedor, tranquilo.
description:
A room with a single bed, cozy, in a renovated apartment with lots of light in an endearing neighborhood in Madrid. Green areas, many shops and very well connected. Close to the airport and Calle Alcalá, one of Madrid's arteries that goes directly to the center. The Barrio de la Concepción metro station is three minutes away. 10 min away: Quintana, Sales. Buses to downtown: 21, 146 Wifi, central heating. Quiet and quiet. Free parking.
English spoken fluently /On parle Francais.
neighborhood_overview:
It is a quiet, traditional neighborhood, with its square, several green areas and parks, with shops, bars and restaurants.
The apartment faces a very short street with little traffic and several gardens. There is total peace of mind. There are several supermarkets that you can walk to very close, dry cleaners, fruit shops, pastry shops, etc. A 10-minute walk away is Calle Alcalá, one of the arteries of Madrid that goes directly to the center, Gran Vía and Sol. Barajas Adolfo Suárez Airport is a 10-15 minute drive.

Directions
A 3-minute walk away is the Barrio de la Concepción metro station. Quintana, Pueblo Nuevo, Ventas, and El Carmen metro stops are a 10-minute walk away. Countless buses that take you downtown directly such as 21 or 146.

host_about:
Soy muy sociable, me encanta conocer gente, soy muy hospitalaria, encantadora, divertida y muy agradable, me gusta la música, leer, el cine, el teatro, el arte, el diseño, la decoración, la moda, cocinar y sobre todo viajar, he estado en muchos países de los cinco continentes y en algunos varias  . Me gusta mucho salir, sola o con amigos y pasear en general.  Australiana de nacimiento, padre español y madre franco-española totalmente bilingüe inglés-español.  Además de vivir en Australia he vivido en Japón, Sudáfrica y Londres.  Soy muy buena anfitriona, me encanta recibir gente en casa. Soy muy adaptable y conciliadora, me gusta que en casa se respire paz y armonía.  Me encanta una buena conversación de cualquier tema y tengo amigos de todas las edades.  Estoy doctorada en psicóloga, experta en Recursos Humanos. Me encantan los animales y podría vivir rodeada de ellos, tengo dos gatitas a las que adoro.  Me encanta el campo pero también soy muy cosmopolita.  Venid¡¡¡ Lo pasaréis muy bien.

I'm very sociable, friendly and outgoing, I love meeting people, I am very hospitable, charming, amusing, funny and very nice, I like music, reading, cinema, theater, art, design, decoration, fashion, cooking and especially traveling, I have been in many countries of the five continents and in some of them several times I love going out, alone or with friends and walking around in general.  I was born and raised in Australia, my father was Spanish and my mother French-Spanish, I am totally bilingual in English and Spanish.  In addition to living in Australia I have lived in Japan, South Africa and London. I am a very hospitable, I love to receive people at home.  I am very adaptable and conciliatory, I like a peaceful and harmonious atmosphere at home. I love a good conversation of any topic and I have friends of all ages. I'm a PhD in psychologist, human resources expert. I love animals and could live surrounded by them, I have two female cats and I adore them. I love the countryside but I'm also very cosmopolitan. Come and visit me¡¡¡, you will have a great time.

neighborhood_overview:
Description of the Zone: Chamartin

The Chamartin district is a charming area that combines an spirit and modern residential buildings and Chalets surrounded by gardens and quiet streets perfect for strolling, with many shopping and business areas where you can find all kinds of stores, supermarkets and one of the best markets in Madrid, the Potosi, for its variety in all kinds of high quality food. Likewise there is a wide variety of restaurants of all types and categories, catering for Spanish and international cuisine. With typical Tapas bars and pubs, cafes, etc open late into the night accompany them as a complement to the activities of leisure, Pubs and Clubs of live music and so on. Through the Metro stations in Colombia and Cuzco, the area is communicated directly with the airport and the site of the International Fair of Madrid IFEMA at least 4 stations, as well as the Chamartin train station and the famous Santiago Bernabeu Stadium, the home of Real Madrid's footba
host_about:

I've been living in the charming city of Madrid for 14 years.

name: La casa de Cheyenne.
description:
The decor reflects my person, as I like to live. It's a warm, cheerful, comfortable house with vintage details and nods to the cinema.
It is important for me to come into the house and feel a comfortable environment.
Destined for families or quiet couples who come to sightseeing without causing problems in the neighborhood. No parties or attitudes that may disturb the neighbors' rest. No one other than the guests will be able to enter the house other than the guests.
neighborhood_overview:
The Barrio de La Latina is the most chaste and picturesque neighborhood in the city center.
One step from the house you have the Trail, where you can find antiques and unique and original objects.
It has the Teatro de La Latina and several small theatres, as well as serving as a "stage" for most of the films that are filmed in Madrid, and in its streets it is not difficult to meet famous people from the seventh art, culture or television.
The pedestrian character of most of its many squares means that its terraces are full every afternoon from the beginning of spring until well into autumn and that it gathers large crowds of young and middle-aged people on weekend nights, enjoying its bars, taverns and restaurants. In its buildings - most of them already rehabilitated - the last representatives of the most popular generations still coexist with the most bohemian young people of a medium-high economic level.

The neighborhood of la Latina has been constituted

Me encanta viajar y conocer gente de diferentes culturas. 
Mi pasión es el mar y los animales.

name: Precioso apartamento en el corazón de Madrid
description:
Thanks to the central location of this accommodation, you can visit all the tourist areas on foot.

Beautiful 100m2 apartment in the historic letter district, the literary heart of Madrid. Living room with large windows to the street and super well lit, very comfortable and pleasant to spend time, work or rest. It has a room with a double bed and a room with two bunk beds with comfortable mattresses. It has a bathroom, wireless internet and equipped kitchen.
neighborhood_overview:
The name of the Barrio de las Letras is a tribute to the great writers who came to life in its streets during the Spanish Golden Age. Cervantes, Lope de Vega and Quevedo give their names to some of its most famous streets. Literary quotations from his best works and from other authors adorn the pedestrian pavement with golden letters.

The offer of shops, bars and restaurants in the Barrio de las Letras is huge. This is one of the most charming and most attractive neighborhoods in Madrid. To this is added the tranquility and collection of a pedestrian environment free of traffic in its main streets.

In the heart of Madrid, you can walk to almost all the main tourist attractions of the city, such as museums, theaters, La Gran Vía, Parque el Retiro, Plaza Santa Ana, El Círculo de Bellas Artes, Cibeles, Puerta de Alcalá, Plaza Sol, etc.

Calle Quevedo is a beautiful, small street with a famous cider house and two bars, all with a terrace.

Description of the Zone: Chamartin

The Chamartin district is a charming area that combines an spirit and modern residential buildings and Chalets surrounded by gardens and quiet streets perfect for strolling, with many shopping and business areas where you can find all kinds of stores, supermarkets and one of the best markets in Madrid, the Potosi, for its variety in all kinds of high quality food. Likewise there is a wide variety of restaurants of all types and categories, catering for Spanish and international cuisine. With typical Tapas bars and pubs, cafes, etc open late into the night accompany them as a complement to the activities of leisure, Pubs and Clubs of live music and so on. Through the Metro stations in Colombia and Cuzco, the area is communicated directly with the airport and the site of the International Fair of Madrid IFEMA at least 4 stations, as well as the Chamartin train station and the famous Santiago Bernabeu Stadium, the home of Real Madrid's footba

name: Penthouse near Nuevos Ministerios
description:
Spectacular brand new design penthouse with garage included in the price.

The penthouse consists of a bedroom, bathroom, living room with kitchenette and a terrace with morning sun.

The sofa is an Italian-style bed, comfortable enough for a guest to sleep comfortably for even more than a week.

Everything is new and prepared to the smallest detail so that it is only necessary to enter to live.
neighborhood_overview:
The penthouse is less than five minutes walk from El Corte Inglés de Nuevos Ministerios (the largest in Spain) and Calle Orense, full of fashion stores such as Zara or H&M, bookstores, restaurants ...

On the other side, also a very short distance away, you will find a traditional Madrid market full of life and shops with fresh food.

There is a supermarket less than a minute away which is very convenient.
host_about: I love to travel and host. We like to respect our guests giving them a homey feeling, where they can come and go with full flexibility. In the future, we'd like to have a small boutique hotel :)

description:
Spacious and modern apartment located in the center of Madrid, in the well-known, tourist and so fashionable Barrio de Las Letras. name: Cibeles , centro de Madrid.oferta.
description: Located in Plaza de Cibeles the heart and most characteristic place of Madrid next to the Paseo del Prado , a UNESCO World Heritage Site , from where you can walk to any place, museum , theater and emblematic neighborhood of the city. It has a stop for all buses  and metro.House with a lot of charm. A very comfortable attic distributed over two floors.
neighborhood_overview: The location is unbeatable in the neighborhood of Las Cortes, 300m from the famous Cibeles fountain, 5 min from the Prado museum, 1min from the thyssen museum, 5 min from the Queen Sofia museum, 1 min from the congress of deputies, 1 min zarzuela theatre, 1 min Cibeles square, 5 min Alcalá gate, 5 min Puerta del Sol, you can enjoy a pleasant walk through the Plaza Mayor and reach the impressive Palacio de Oriente in 10 minutes. Connection of all buses in Cibeles including the airport 1 min, and metro station 2 min, five minutes from the fun neighborhood of letters and 5 minutes from the well-known mile of gold. You can enjoy the colourful and lively neighborhood of Chueca and Malasaña within 5 minutes. Vive Madrid, I look forward to seeing you!

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the vibrant neighborhood of Atocha!

Immerse yourself in the Art Walk, home to renowned collections at the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum, the Prado, and the Reina Sofía. Nearby, discover the Círculo de Bellas Artes, CaixaForum, as well as theaters like Infanta Isabel and María Guerrero.

Explore a variety of shops offering decor, art, antiques, and crafts, especially in the nearby Las Letras district. Just minutes away, Galerías Canalejas awaits with exclusive shops, trendy restaurants, and cafes.

Our area is a culinary paradise. Experience Madrid's authenticity at local markets like San Antón, or choose from a wide selection of restaurants and bars, from traditional to creative. Every bite here is a unique experience!

Discover Atocha and experience Madrid like never before!

Soy una joven chica súper activa y apasionada de mi trabajo.

Trato de tener siempre una sonrisa cuando la situación lo amerita, pero igualmente odio que me defrauden, ya que es gente que pasa por mi lado sin pena ni gloria. Pero de lo contrario soy feliz con mi vida y trato de  transmitirlo a todos los que me rodean, en especial a la gente que me quiere.

Mas o menos estas serian mis pinceladas de la aproximación de lo que soy.

Chamartín is a quiet and elegant neighborhood located in the north of Madrid, offering a wealth of attractions for tourists. It is a well connected neighborhood, which has several metro stations, nearby and buses that will allow you to quickly reach anywhere in the city.

Chamartín is known for being a residential neighborhood, so it offers plenty of green spaces and pedestrian areas. One of the most iconic spots in the neighborhood is Berlin Park, which has a large pond and beautiful scenery. You can also find other parks such as the City of Journalists Park, Isabel II Canal Park and Santander Park.

The area is also perfect for shopping lovers, as it has several shopping centers such as Centro Comercial La Vaguada, one of the largest in Madrid, which offers a great variety of shops and restaurants.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the famous neighbourhood of Las Letras in Madrid, whose name is a tribute to the great writers who made life in its streets during the Spanish Golden Age. In addition, the apartment is a 5-minute walk from Puerta del Sol and 15 minutes from Madrid's Gran Vía and is perfectly connected to the rest of the city by public transport.

neighborhood_overview:
Description of the Zone: Chamartin

The Chamartin district is a charming area that combines an spirit and modern residential buildings and Chalets surrounded by gardens and quiet streets perfect for strolling, with many shopping and business areas where you can find all kinds of stores, supermarkets and one of the best markets in Madrid, the Potosi, for its variety in all kinds of high quality food. Likewise there is a wide variety of restaurants of all types and categories, catering for Spanish and international cuisine. With typical Tapas bars and pubs, cafes, etc open late into the night accompany them as a complement to the activities of leisure, Pubs and Clubs of live music and so on. Through the Metro stations in Colombia and Cuzco, the area is communicated directly with the airport and the site of the International Fair of Madrid IFEMA at least 4 stations, as well as the Chamartin train station and the famous Santiago Bernabeu Stadium, the home of Real Madrid's footba

name: Disfrute Madrid en Chamberí
description:
Enjoy a great experience in this central and cozy penthouse on the 7th floor, bright and quiet in the best area of the Chamberí neighborhood in Madrid! Recently refurbished.
In a building with modern interior finishes, with a concierge. It has a bedroom with a closet, a bathroom with a shower, a spacious living room with a sofa bed, and a fully equipped kitchen. You can find many stores and restaurants.
Close to embassies, cultural centers, and Masters.
host_about:
Estoy encantada de hospedar a gente de diferentes culturas y países, e intentaré que se sientan como en su casa. 
Yo misma comparto la nacionalidad española con la de México, país donde nací y pasé mi infancia y parte de mi juventud.
He convivido con maravillosas familias norteamericanas y canadienses, a través de intercambios juveniles, y con ellas aprendí la importancia de conocer  las diferentes culturas que enriquecen nuestras vidas y nos hacen tolerantes y abiertos a las diferencias.
Más tarde, por razones laborales he residido varios años en Bélgica y viajado por la mayor parte de los países europeos, y varias naciones asiáticas y africanas que me permitieron conocer a personas de las que conservo los mejores recuerdos.

name: Estudio con terraza en Madrid Centro
description:
You are welcome to this central and cozy art studio in the heart of Madrid!!

Located on the second floor with an elevator, on the pedestrian street of Arenal, between Sol and the Royal Palace, a 3-minute walk.

It consists of a living room, equipped kitchen, wifi, SmartTv, full bathroom, 150x 200 bathroom, 150x 200 bed in the loft and double sofa bed in the living room , balcony with views and the Teatro Real de Madrid.
Studio for two.
No washing machine.
neighborhood_overview: In the neighborhood you can find everything. Luxury shops, traditional shops, tourist items, fashion shops, food stores, supermarkets, churches, cultural sites, emblematic buildings, parks, street performers, nightclubs, restaurants, bars, terraces
host_about:
Soy animadora sociocultural. Me encanta viajar, conocer otras culturas y lenguas, por eso me gusta alojar viajeros en mi estudio!! Podemos comunicarnos en inglés, francés o alemán también. He vivido cinco años en Suiza y viajado por muchos países del mundo.
Me apasiona la danza, el Arte en general y la lectura. Podrás ver algunas obras de arte en el estudio, así como algunos libros. 
Me interesan las terapias alternativas y el crecimiento personal para intentar hacer un mundo mejor. 
Practico senderismo, meditación, natación y no puedo pasar un día sin bailar! Me encanta disfrutar del sol, la naturaleza y perderme en las ciudades! 
Soy positiva y optimista!
La frase que me define es: Vive cada día como si fuera el último!!
Estaré encantada de ofrecerte rutas, actividades o propuestas en función de tus intereses.
Me gusta tener todo a punto y listo para que no te falte de nada cuando estés alojad@ en mi estudio. Estoy disponible durante tu estancia en Madrid, con el móvil por si tienes cualquier duda o pregunta. Ahora solo queda venir y disfrutar de  tu estancia!
Feliz Viaje!!!!

The rooms are for single use, while the house and common areas are shared among the tenants, this includes the kitchen with all its equipment. The rent price includes all costs and services, ie: electricity, water, gas, Internet wifi, telephone, beddings (sheets and towels, washed and changed for you), cleaning products, iron and optional lunch.
Located in the district of Chamberí, one of the most sought after places in Madrid for its relaxing and lively atmosphere and, obviously, tapas. name: Piso Luminoso Barrio de las Letras, Madrid Centro
description:
Cozy 60 m2 flat in the centre of Madrid, perfectly located near main museums (El Prado, Thyssen) and landmarks.
The building is in Anton Martin, part of the literary quarter of Madrid (Barrio de las letras), one of the most popular neighbourhoods for its charming pedestrian streets and many shops and restaurants that years ago was home for very recognized artists like Cervantes, Lope de Vega and Quevedo.
host_about:
Hola! 

Soy Alvaro, un chico nacido en Madrid pero que ha vivido en el extranjero desde que prácticamente tiene uso de razón. Si, me gusta viajar, conocer nuevas culturas, enriquecerme de ellas adentrándome en lo más profundo de cada lugar.

Los principales motivos que me han llevado a vivir en California (1 año) y Londres (8 años) han sido meramente profesionales. Decidí que era lo mejor para formarme en el ámbito de la tecnología aplicada al marketing. Eso que decidí estudiar cuando era un niño y que me ha permitido crecer como persona.

Llevo hospedando a gente con Airbnb cerca de dos años y sinceramente disfruto mucho con ello,  tanto que me he dado cuenta me gustaría dar un vuelco a mi vida profesional y personal y empezar a trabajar en nuevo proyecto, un eco lodge. Esto permitirá unir mis pasiones por el hospedaje, la naturaleza, la salud, espiritualidad, la gente y porque no, el negocio sostenible.

Mientras sigo definiendo el proyecto desde Madrid, una ciudad bellísima por su gente, su comida, su historia y arquitectura, quisiera seguir nutriéndome de otras culturas, quizá, conociéndote ti y tú punto de vista sobre este mundo que compartimos.



Un saludo y buen viaje!

name: Lovely flat just by the city center (full unit)
description:
The flat is 20 min away from the famous neighborhood of La Latina and is within walking distance of the massive park Casa de Campo, where you can enjoy an evening on the terrace with the city views, quality barbeque, or a glass of wine.
Other famous attractions in the area are Mercado Tirso de Molina, where you can enjoy authentic tapas, or the main road of Paseo de Extremadura, which is full of very well-priced fruterias, and other small local businesses, bakeries, bookshops and bars.
neighborhood_overview: It is a very colourful, familiar neighbourhood where you'll find the uniqueness and diversity of Madrid. All the fruterias are super cheap and have wonderful options, it's green and has wonderful views of the city. There are very little places in Madrid where you can see some panoramic views and the neighbourhood of Puerta de Angel is one of those!

name: Lavapies Centrally Located!
description: This renovated apartment is located in the Lavapiés neighborhood in the center of Madrid. This apartment is ideal for two people or a couple (or a couple with a baby/small child). You are walking distance to many interesting places in the city, and you’ll find everything you’ll need for a comfortable and relaxing experience. Newly furnished, there is a well stocked kitchen and living facilities, making it a great place for both short-term and long-term stays.
neighborhood_overview: One of the most vibrant and interesting neighborhoods in Madrid, Lavapiés is very lively and surrounded by restaurants from all over the world, bars, theaters, art galleries and museums including the Prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen. Antón Martin Market is very close, as is the Filmoteca/Cinema Doré. You can easily access all other areas of the city including the historic center such as the Playa Mayor (15 mins walk), as well as the beautiful Retiro Park (20 mins walk). And it is impossible to get bored in the neighborhood as Time Out Magazine confirms. From La Casa Encendida to La Tabacalera, passing by La Calle Doctor Fourquet with the most interesting contemporary art galleries in Madrid. The best Pizzeria in the capital: La Saletta, an open secret within the Antón Martín Market or the Baobab restaurant in Nelson Mandela Square, are just some of the places that invite you to travel without traveling, based on real flavors at fair prices in the Lavapiés neighborhood.
host_about:
Living in New York my whole life, I have been on Eastern L.I. since 2010. I love to travel, read, hike, hang out at the beach, and try new things. I recently bought an apartment in my favorite city, Madrid too!

As a guest, I love meeting different people and discovering new cultures. I definitely prefer to stay at local places to become immersed in that area and try to get a sense of what life is really like!

name: COZY APARTMENT MADRID MALASAÑA
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood in which it is located – Malasaña - is known for its alternative vibe that makes it compare to this neighborhood with the Camden Town of London, the East Village of New York or the Upper Quarter in Lisbon. Located between Chueca and Argüelles, Malasaña was the center of the so-called Madrid Movida of the 70s and the 80s. Its streets are filled with people of all ages and styles, and it has driven projects and small businesses related to art, fashion, and culture.
host_about: ¡Hola! Somos una pareja a la que nos encanta disfrutar del centro de Madrid: pasear, su oferta cultural, su gente y su gastronomía. Según creció nuestra familia tuvimos que renunciar a vivir en el centro pero mantuvimos sendos apartamentos para poder compartirlos con personas de todos los países. Disfrutamos ofreciendo una experiencia del Madrid auténtico, tradicional y antiguo, en un apartamento limpio, con todo lo necesario.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood of Chamberí, where the street Manuel Silvela is located, is one of the most emblematic and charming areas of Madrid. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and its blend of tradition and modernity, Chamberí offers a wide range of activities, shops, restaurants, and cultural attractions.

Manuel Silvela Street, in particular, is a quiet and residential street, yet still close to a variety of amenities and services. From here, it's easy to access parks, museums, local shops, and renowned restaurants.

Chamberí is also known for its elegant architecture and beautiful historic buildings, adding a special charm to the area. In summary, living on Manuel Silvela Street in Chamberí offers a unique experience in one of Madrid's most desirable and dynamic areas.

description: Enjoy the simplicity of this quiet and central accommodation. Located in the most avant-garde area. neighborhood_overview:
The tourist area of Lavapiés is located southeast of the city's central almond. Like neighboring La Latina, its steep, narrow and irregularly woven streets retain their medieval origin as a suburb that extended outside the walls of the citadel when Madrid became capital of the kingdom in 1561.

Lavapiés has since maintained its character as a neighborhood inhabited mostly by the popular classes of the city. This has given rise to buildings of a peculiar physiognomy: houses of various heights built around a central courtyard, called corralas, whose best example can be found at the confluence of the streets Tribulete and Mesón de Paredes.

Lavapiés is one of the best examples of the chaste and sainetera tradition of the people of Madrid, which became popular in many of the zarzuelas written in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries, especially in El barberillo de Lavapiés by Francisco Asenjo Barbieri. This typically Madrid folk legacy coexists in harmony wi

name: Cozy room in Anton Martin, Madrid Centro
description:
Cozy room in a 60 m2 shared flat in the centre of Madrid, perfectly located near main museums (El Prado, Thyssen) and landmarks.
The building is in Anton Martin, part of the literary quarter of Madrid (Barrio de las letras), one of the most popular neighbourhoods for its charming pedestrian streets and many shops and restaurants that years ago was home for very recognized artists like Cervantes, Lope de Vega and Quevedo.
host_about:
Hola! 

Soy Alvaro, un chico nacido en Madrid pero que ha vivido en el extranjero desde que prácticamente tiene uso de razón. Si, me gusta viajar, conocer nuevas culturas, enriquecerme de ellas adentrándome en lo más profundo de cada lugar.

Los principales motivos que me han llevado a vivir en California (1 año) y Londres (8 años) han sido meramente profesionales. Decidí que era lo mejor para formarme en el ámbito de la tecnología aplicada al marketing. Eso que decidí estudiar cuando era un niño y que me ha permitido crecer como persona.

Llevo hospedando a gente con Airbnb cerca de dos años y sinceramente disfruto mucho con ello,  tanto que me he dado cuenta me gustaría dar un vuelco a mi vida profesional y personal y empezar a trabajar en nuevo proyecto, un eco lodge. Esto permitirá unir mis pasiones por el hospedaje, la naturaleza, la salud, espiritualidad, la gente y porque no, el negocio sostenible.

Mientras sigo definiendo el proyecto desde Madrid, una ciudad bellísima por su gente, su comida, su historia y arquitectura, quisiera seguir nutriéndome de otras culturas, quizá, conociéndote ti y tú punto de vista sobre este mundo que compartimos.



Un saludo y buen viaje!

host_about:
Nacido en Madrid, soy Técnico de Diseño y trabajo para una multinacional americana. Sociable, extrovertido y Apasionado de los deportes, actualmente practico artes marciales, natación, buceo, pilates y yoga. Me gusta tanto la montaña como el mar. El poco tiempo libre restante intento pasarlo con mis amigos.
Me fascina viajar y conocer cualquier tipo de cultura y me encanta leer sobre astrología, mitología, arte, historia y de la actualidad.

name: Penthouse in the center Gran Vía.Petfriendly
neighborhood_overview:
It is the neighborhood of Malasaña in the downtown district of Madrid. The apartment is located 10 seconds from the famous Gran Vía street and Plaza de Callao and 30 seconds from the subway. You can walk to all the city's tourist spots and it takes no more than 15 minutes to get almost anywhere. The Thyssen Museum, El Prado, Caixaforum, Reina Sofia are just a short walk from home. The Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor are a 5-minute walk away. Next to home you can enjoy shows of all kinds, ballets, cinemas, restaurants, bookstores, supermarkets, nightlife, shops, hairdressers and 10 steps away there is a police station. There are buses next door to the sports stadiums and Madrid's famous Golden Mile.


Malasaña belongs to the district center in Madrid. My penthouse is 10 seconds to the famous Gran Via and Plaza de Callao, and 30 seconds to the underground. You can go walking to the most of the interesting tourist sites in Madrid.The Thyssen museum , El Prado, Caixaforum

description:
Very bright apartment recently renovated with 3 rooms, next to the mouth of the metro and 3 stops from Atocha and the Retreat. Calle muy comercial, con todo tipo de servicio
The apartment is newly renovated, comfortable, bright.
The apartment situation is most recommendable since the subway station is at the door, and in 3 stops you are in the center of Madrid (15 minutes walk) to Atocha (train station) and the great Museums and all kinds of nocturnal night activities.
Wi-Fi 200 MB and Cable TV
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment situation is highly recommended as the metro station is at the door, and in 3 stops you are in the center of Madrid (15 minutes walk) to Atocha which is the most important train station in Madrid and the Retiro, the great park of our City, and the great Museums (Prado Museum, Reina Sofia and Museo Thyssen) as well as Cinemas, Theaters and all kinds of activities for night trips.
Also right next door, there is a bus station with more than 10 day lines and 5 night buses (throughout the night) that go to all points of the city, that is, perfectly and constantly connected.

The area is very lively, there are markets, supermarkets, pharmacy, banks, bars, restaurants, bakeries, small grocery stores, laundry, post office, and all kinds of diverse services and shops.
It's a very safe area with a constant flow of people as the subway is right next door and the street is full of amenities.

name: ***CENTRAL*** STUDIO HEART of MADRID. WHITE.
description:
Beautiful apartment in the center of Madrid. Located in the emblematic Barrio de Las Letras, a few meters from the Puerta del Sol and the most important museums in the city. It has a kitchen, living room and bedroom, hot and cold Air Conditioning, wooden floors and a beautiful design to enjoy a pleasant and cozy stay.

Check in from 15:00. Key collection at the ¨Locker in the City¨ locker located close to the apartment, you can also rent a box for your suitcases.
neighborhood_overview:
Location
Madrid, Community of Madrid, Spain
One of the most emblematic neighborhoods of the center of Madrid. A few minutes from the Reina Sofía Museum of Contemporary Art and the Prado Museum.
Quiet neighborhood with many original restaurants and beautiful shops.
You can find there the Film Library, in the Ciné Doré, with a beautiful facade dating from 1923. You can also find the Mercado de Antón Martín, a combination of old food stalls with modern bars where you can taste from a Japanese menu to a Spanish one.
 In this area some of the most prominent writers of the Spanish Golden Age, such as Miguel de Cervantes, Quevedo and Góngora, established their residence.

name: Nice,light 2 bedroom condo in the center of Madrid
description:
This nice condominium is walking distance to Palacio Real, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, Royal Theatre (Opera), barrio La Latina, among other areas with plenty of restaurants, bars and cultural attractions. Furthermore, it is close to Principe Pio, one of the main railway stations, making it easy to plan one day trips to beautiful destinations such as Toledo, Segovia, Avila, Cáceres, among others.
M
neighborhood_overview:
Despite the fact the apartment is located in a centric area, calle mazarredo is a quite street.

On the corner of mazarredo street and Segovia avenue you will find Atenas Park and next to it Campo del Moro (Royal Palace gardens).

If you walk up stairs in the cross between Segovia avenue and Ronda de Segovia street, you will get Madrid’s cathedral (La Almudena) in less than 10 minutes, and next to it the Royal Palace. On the other side of a square called plaza de Oriente, you will find The Royal Theatre (Opera).

If you walk from La Almudena along calle Mayor, you will get to Mercado de San Miguel and Plaza Mayor on your right side, and if you continue by calle Mayor, you will get to Puerta del Sol. There are plenty of shopping options around this area, specially walking along Preciados street towards Gran via.

neighborhood_overview: Lavapiés is the most popular and authentic district of Madrid. Known for its multiculturalism, it offers many bars and restaurants where you can enjoy the best cuisine of the world. You can find several theatres, popular markets and the most famous flea market every Sundays.
host_about: I am 37. Was born in Winnipeg Canada, but I am portuguese. Have lived in Barcelona Spain for more than 10 years and for the last 5 have been living in Madrid. In 2014 I moved for 1 year and a half to Moscow Russia to be working in the Sochi Winter Olympic and Paralympic Games. After that I moved to Rio de Janeiro Brasil for 3 months to work in the Football World Cup and now I am back in Madrid. I work in Sports Media Broadcast and for my work I travel a lot. I speak 5 different languages (portuguese, english, french, italian and spanish) and I love travelling for pleasure; having the chance to meet new people and share different experiences.

name: Unique flat with medieval city wall
description:
"La Muralla" is a stunning design apartment recently renewed with a unique style, keeping all the charm of one of the most important nobiliar buildings of the City and combining it with the finest design and comfort.
You will have the priviledge of living with the medieval city wall inside the apartment. Close to Plaza Mayor, San Miguel Market, Sol, in the cool district of La Latina, it is the perfect setting for a unique experience really in the center of Madrid.
neighborhood_overview:
Very centric, only 5 min walking from Plaza Mayor, Sol, Royal Palace and barrio de las letras with all the most.important museums. It is located in the quiet and authentic distric of La Latina: this area perfectly summarizes what Madrid and Spain in general is all about. Tapas, people happily chatting in the streets and weekends get together for a lunch or a caña under the Madrid sun.


Another good reason to choose La Latina is the Fiesta de la Paloma, a neighborhood party taking place for a week in the middle of August where everybody goes wild: stage with concerts, food trucks, an ocean of people all over the barrio.

Let's not forget that La Latina is also where the famous Rastro market takes place, which gives this neighborhood a big plus: don't miss out on Europe's most iconic street market (every Sunday starting from 9 am until around 2 pm), get a good deal on some furniture, vintage purse or vinyl records and then head to either Plaza Cascorro or Puert
host_about:
I'm italian, but I live in Madrid since 8 years. Don Pedro Home was the house I was going to live in, that's why the detailing is very careful. I chose the best materials,   original design furniture, with a personal touch that belongs to my way of being.
And now  I will be glad to share all of this with my guests.

description:
Newly renovated apartment located in one of the most exclusive areas of Madrid. The rooms are of various sizes and types, however all of them dispose of the same services included in the price. The rooms are for single use, while the house and common areas are shared among the tenants, this includes the kitchen with all its equipment. The property has 3 bathrooms with shower + 1 toilet (allocated by room). There is also a large living room of 35 m2. The rent price includes all costs and services, ie: electricity, water, gas, Internet wifi, telephone, beddings (sheets and towels, washed and changed for you), cleaning products, iron and optional lunch.
Located in the district of Chamberí, one of the most sought after places in Madrid for its relaxing and lively atmosphere and, obviously, tapas. Private room with lock inside and out and own key in family flat with terrace, Latino family with a pet dog, we are 3 people on the floor. Nice atmosphere.

Bus stop directly in front of Sol or Hospital 12 de Octubre.
Metro station (Plaza elliptica/ Almendrales) and renfe(October 12) a 10 min walk away
Supermarket and bazaar very close.
Parks, green areas and sports areas are very close.
Plaza Río 2 shopping mall 15 min walk or direct bus
neighborhood_overview:
The Usera neighborhood is multicultural so I think it's very easy to feel comfortable. Pradolongo Park with lake right in front of the house. Latin, Chinese, and Spanish everywhere in the neighborhood. Shopping mall nearby.
Downtown a few metro or bus stops that connects Usera directly with Sol.

name: La Estación
description: Located in an area influenced by the old 19th century train station of Delicias, now converted into the Museo del Ferrocarril in Madrid. Films were recorded at the station, such as Doctor Zhivago who won 5 Oscars among others. You will also have endless tourist information, books in various languages as well as board games and endless surprises that will make your visit to Madrid an unforgettable trip!
neighborhood_overview:
The Barrio de Delicias is located in a privileged position.
Influenced by the old train station of Delicias inaugurated in 1880, today converted into the Museum of the Railway of Madrid. Façades and buildings still predominate with a clear railway style, which give this stay an ancient and romantic "taste" capable of making you feel in an authentic oasis within the hustle and bustle of the city.
Located just 10 minutes walk from the "Matadero" cultural space, and next to this "Madrid Rio" a huge playful enclave parallel to the Manzanares River, as well as the "Plaza Rio 2 Shopping Center".
Walking just 20 minutes north, you'll find the " Reina Sofia" (Spain's most visited art museum), or the iconic Atocha station.
host_about: Seriedad en el trabajo, empatía y eficiencia.

name: Room Mate Madrid - Luxury living in Madrid center, 1ESP | DELUXE ROOM
description:
Newly renovated apartment located in one of the most exclusive areas of Madrid. The rooms are of various sizes and types, however all of them dispose of the same services included in the price. The rooms are for single use, while the house and common areas are shared among the tenants, this includes the kitchen with all its equipment. The property has 3 bathrooms with shower + 1 toilet (allocated by room). There is also a large living room of 35 m2. The rent price includes all costs and services, ie: electricity, water, gas, Internet wifi, telephone, beddings (sheets and towels, washed and changed for you), cleaning products, iron and optional lunch.
Located in the district of Chamberí, one of the most sought after places in Madrid for its relaxing and lively atmosphere and, obviously, tapas. description: This stunning chic apartment enjoys one of the best locations in downtown Madrid, near the Royal Palace -between Puerta de Moros and the old “Campillo de las Vistillas”- and within walking distance to many of the capital’s most famous sights and “must-do” attractions. Beautifully furnished with antique pieces and to the highest standards, it has been fully renovated in a contemporary style which will make your stay an unforgettable one.
neighborhood_overview:
The Royal Palace, the Opera, the Plaza Mayor -Madrid's most famous square- are just a short walk away, as is the Puerta del Sol. The streets immediately surrounding are full of legends and history, with corner, patios, hidden gardens, old style stores in narrow pedestrian streets, perfect for exploring on foot. The neighborhood is renowned for its excellent restaurants and taverns modern and traditional alike which come alive in the weekends as people partake in the truly Madrileño pastime of enjoying tapas and a drink or two in the afternoon or early evening. While you are in the center of the capital with its aliveness, dynamism and magic, you will really feel like you are in a small quiet town.
Don Pedro Street is a public thoroughfare in Madrid, running from east to west from the Puerta de Moros square to the old campillo de las Vistillas in the Palacio neighborhood. The Puerta de Moros was one of the gateways to Madrid. It was located on the canvas of the Christian wall and c
host_about: I love getting lost and finding special places. I love music, food, cooking, movies and most of all I love creating spaces where people can feel at home.

name: Pleasant stay in studio near Gran Via
description: Modern and bright studio located near Gran Vía in Madrid. Entirely equipped, a double bed and a sofa bed are at your disposal. Washing machine, hair dryer and ironing set are also included. Linens and towels will be provided. or more information do not hesitate to read the detailed description below. :)
neighborhood_overview:
The studio is located in the Malasaña district.

Bubbling with life at any time of day – and often long into the night – Malasaña is Madrid’s hippest neighbourhood. From stunning architecture to hip little bars and restaurants, the district is overflowing with things to do and see. Surrounding Plaza del 2 de Mayo and near the Tribunal Metro stop, the trendy neighborhood is just minutes from Sol and a short walk to the most sought after museums and cultural hotspots. The district counts Madrid’s Gran Vía, also known as the "Madrid Broadway". It is one of the most memorable spaces to walk around the city and find a large number of restaurants, cafes, theaters, cinemas and above all: fashion stores.

You will be close to a Carrefour Express supermarket.

Places to visit:
- Puerta del Sol.
- Plaza Mayor.
- Palacio Real de Madrid.
- Parque del Buen Retiro.
- Palacio de Cristal.
- Museo Nacional del Prado.
- Centro Cultural Co
host_about:
Dear future guests,

I love travelling, so I’m often absent. For me, the best way to get to know a city is by living there like a local person, and this can only be done, of course, by getting accommodation. It is with this in mind that whenever I am travelling, I make my lodging facility available to travelers from around the world, so: why not you?

Don’t worry, even if I’m not present when you are doing the booking arrangement, Luckey, Airbnb’s official concierge, to whom I have entrusted the management of my home, will make your stay as enjoyable as possible!

See you soon,

José Manuel. 

Estimados futuros huéspedes,

Me encanta viajar, así que a menudo estoy ausente. Para mí, la mejor manera de conocer una ciudad es viviendo allí como una persona local, y esto solo se puede hacer, por supuesto, obteniendo alojamiento. Es con esto en mente que cada vez que viajo, pongo mi alojamiento a disposición de viajeros de todo el mundo, entonces: ¿por qué no usted?

No se preocupe, incluso si no estoy presente cuando están haciendo el acuerdo de reserva, Luckey, el conserje oficial de Airbnb, a quien he confiado la administración de mi hogar, hará que su estadía sea lo más agradable posible.

Le veo pronto,

José Manuel.

Residence with 7 rooms. There is a large kitchen and refrigerators for customer use. Use of optional washing machine for 3 euros.
Very nice.
Great discount for months.

host_about:
Hola.
Hace tiempo que vivo en el centro de Madrid. Me gusta ir caminando a los principales lugares y contemplar la historia de sus edificios, además es habitual encontrar ofertas culturales solo con pasear.
Deseo que los viajeros que ocupen mi estudio sigan diciendo que les resulta muy agradable. Mi disposición es ayudar para que se cumplan esos objetivos y responder si tienen cualquier problema.

name: Cozy 19th century penthouse
description:
Charming attic completely renovated and equipped. It is a quiet and very bright place in the historic center. It has exposed wooden beams that give it a special and cozy charm.
It is located in the multicultural neighborhood of Lavapies, a neighborhood full of life and culture with bars and restaurants serving world cuisine. It is located 10-15 minutes from a lot of interesting museums and Atocha Station. It has 4 nearby metro stations: Aton Martin, Tirso de Molina, Lavapies and La Latina.
host_about:
Madrileño de nacimiento y gran conocedor de Lavapies donde llevo viviendo desde el año 2000. Soy una persona entusiasta, inquieta y comprometida, trabajo en una cooperativa de productos ecológicos y de Comercio Justo desde hace más de 17 años. Intento ser un consumidor responsable, en la casa los productos de limpieza y el desayuno son ecológicos y de comercio justo claro!Me gusta el cine, viajar el deporte y cultivar la amistad. Colectivo LGTBI más que bienvenido!
Carpe Diem!

neighborhood_overview:
Our home is located in the center of Lavapiés, within the almond of central Madrid. Lavapies is a busy and multicultural neighborhood with medieval streets on a hillside full of Indian, Oriental and African restaurants, as well as super bohemian and cosmopolitan bars and cafes and of course also the traditional Spanish bars. The apartment is located in front of the lively San Fernando Market. It is possible to buy cheeses, books and craft beers. Of the most famous events in the neighborhood, we are two streets away from EL Rastro, the most important antiques market in Spain that extends along Calle Ribera de Curtidores to the La Latina neighborhood.
Just down from the apartment we find the important Plaza de Agustín Lara, known for hosting different popular pronunciations, and the historical Schools Pias - UNED Library, a few meters from the cultural centers of the Tabacalera and the Casa Encendida, where cutting-edge exhibitions and events are organized. description:
Best location, right in the center of Madrid! In the famous "Barrio de las Letras" - the literary neighborhood. Beautiful, clean apartment with lots of light in a historic building with elevator. Centrally-located with short walking distance (<10 mins) to all the major museums, Plaza Mayor, Royal Place, Puerta del Sol, Gran Via, Parque del Retiro, Atocha train station, etc.

We are in Barrio de las Letras, the Literary Neighborhood, home of Cervantes who wrote "El Quijote". Walk down our Calle de Huertas and in 10 minutes you will be at the Prado or the Thyssen Museum. Plaza de Santa Ana is around the corner and Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol are only 5 minutes away.
You will be in the center of everything.
host_about: I have lived in Madrid with my family since 2000. We travel a lot and like to stay at apartments ourselves. It makes you feel like you live in that city. I speak several languages and enjoy meeting people from all over the world. It will be my pleasure to host you in Madrid.

description:
This beautifully furnished 45 sqm apartment features one spacious bedroom, a fully-equipped kitchen, a cozy living room, and a stylish bathroom. With sleek and modern finishes, high-quality appliances, and all the amenities you need for a comfortable stay, this apartment is perfect for anyone looking for a home away from home in the heart of Madrid.

neighborhood_overview:
Barrio Malasaña is an absolutely fantastic neighborhood that captures the essence of Madrid's creative and bohemian spirit. It is a place where traditional Spanish charm meets contemporary and edgy urban culture, creating a unique and lively atmosphere that is hard to find elsewhere.

The neighborhood's narrow streets are filled with colorful street art, cozy cafés, independent shops, and trendy bars and restaurants that cater to every taste and budget. Whether you're looking for traditional Spanish tapas, gourmet vegan cuisine, or artisanal cocktails, you'll find it all in Barrio Malasaña.

What's more, the neighborhood is home to a thriving arts and culture scene, with numerous galleries, theaters, and cultural centers that host exhibitions, performances, and events throughout the year. The Conde Duque Cultural Center, in particular, is a must-visit destination for anyone interested in contemporary art and culture.

The neighborhood's lively and friendly

name: Mini luxury flat in the heart of Madrid
description:
MIN stay 1 MONTH. Max 6 Months. Some exceptions can be considered. For longer stays upon request.

This mini luxury apartment with 1 bunk bed and 1 sofa bed, is located right in the city center, in a vibrant, cultural and artistic neighborhood. Situated 2 minutes walk from Callao, 10 min to Sol, Gran Via and Tribunal. Close to many of the sights, shops and great transport links making it the perfect place for your stay in Madrid, for pleasure, work or studies.

Enjoy Madrid in a cool way
neighborhood_overview:
Malasaña is a centric and the trendiest neighborhood of Madrid, a focus for the 'hipster' phenomenon. It is full of lively bars, alternative boutiques, cutting-edge shops, cute florists, amazing bookshops, secret galleries and theatres, organic restaurants and bohemian cafés, overflowing with people mostly in their 30s. The place where you can enjoy authentic Spanish spirit with a special, modern touch to your experience.

The flat is located a few steps from “Plaza de Luna” – a nice square with a theater, rooftop bar, Gym, and many shops, restaurants and cafés. There are 2 supermarkets on the same street, and other 3 nearby (some 24h) where you can do grossers shopping. There is a nice small traditional market in the same building where the flat is located. The street is pretty quiet (there is not any club or disco nearby), and the apartment has noise insulated window.
host_about: Hi everybody! First at all – I love Madrid, and my goal is that you will love it, too! Therefore, I am always happy to provide useful tips to make your stay unforgettable and offer the best service to my visitors. I use AirBnB on the regular basis, when I travel. And I like the idea of exploring new places in friendlier, more close and personalized manner. So, I open my apartment’s doors and I hope you will enjoy my city in an authentic way!

neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is known for Plaza Cuzco and its proximity to Santiago Bernabéu Stadium. It offers easy access to a variety of shops, offices, and restaurants, as well as Paseo de la Castellana, one of Madrid's main streets with more shops and attractions. You'll find traditional neighborhood taverns, Irish pubs, and elegant bars, along with nightclubs.

There are small shops and supermarkets in the area for daily shopping needs. Alcampo supermarket is just 170 meters away. You can also visit La Garriga, a premium food store with a tasting area for breakfast, snacks, and meals.

A few minutes from the apartment, you'll find a VIPs and a Starbucks. For a great dining experience nearby, I recommend trying La Tahona or Sal Y Chili, both fantastic options.

With sleek and modern finishes, high-quality appliances, and all the amenities you need for a comfortable stay, this apartment is perfect for anyone looking for a home away from home in the heart of Madrid.

neighborhood_overview:
Barrio Malasaña is an absolutely fantastic neighborhood that captures the essence of Madrid's creative and bohemian spirit. It is a place where traditional Spanish charm meets contemporary and edgy urban culture, creating a unique and lively atmosphere that is hard to find elsewhere.

The neighborhood's narrow streets are filled with colorful street art, cozy cafés, independent shops, and trendy bars and restaurants that cater to every taste and budget. Whether you're looking for traditional Spanish tapas, gourmet vegan cuisine, or artisanal cocktails, you'll find it all in Barrio Malasaña.

What's more, the neighborhood is home to a thriving arts and culture scene, with numerous galleries, theaters, and cultural centers that host exhibitions, performances, and events throughout the year. The Conde Duque Cultural Center, in particular, is a must-visit destination for anyone interested in contemporary art and culture.

name: Central Bright Double Bedroom near Metro & Museums
description: By-the-sea inspired room designed with traditional and modern furniture in a renovated centrally located 100m2 apartment with direct access to Barajas Airport, Atocha Central Train Station and Mendez Álvaro Sur Bus Station, as well as Puerta de Sol and Museo del Prado. It is also the perfect spot if you also want to visit nearby towns such as Toledo and Segovia as they are UNESCO World Heritage sites. Must visit if you are in Madrid!
neighborhood_overview:
Mostly residential area away from the noisy night drunks, though there are also bars and restaurants around the neighborhood as well as cheap supermarkets and fruit shops. It is also a safe area to hang out at night.

If you are interested in art, the famous Reina Sofia museum is within walking distance, and if you enjoy walking like us, you can also walk to Museo del Prado and other art galleries. We actually seldom take the metro as the walk up to the center is pretty interesting.
host_about:
I'm a designer, a photographer, a modern nomad. I live with less and work from anywhere in the world. So far it has been 8 cities in 3 continents and counting! 

Though I'm a digital designer by profession, I love interior design and took the chance to renovate my mother's decades-old apartment during a trip back so she could live more comfortably. As you can imagine it wasn't an easy task, try telling your parents to throw that old clock stuck at ten to eleven or that weird looking boat that's supposed to bring luck into the family. But we worked out something in the end and I got to take down some walls, placed a new floor that keeps the house super cool in summer, and basically changed all the furniture in the house. 

That boat stayed on though. ;P

My mother is based in Madrid and has been working as a local tour guide for VIP groups from Asian countries and brings them all over Spain, sometimes even to Morocco, Portugal and France. Though tiring she loves her job and meeting people. My sister and I don't stay in Spain normally so she's happy to have company with at the apartment if she's not away on tour.

If you book with us please take care of the house and treat it as your own. I have prepared a guide to give you an overview of the city. If we are at home we'll be happy to help you with planning so you make the most of your stay in the city :)
