name: Confortable piso en barrio de Las Letras/Cortes
description:
Enjoy unforgettable days in this cozy, bright and quiet apartment in the center of Madrid, perfect for short and long seasons. It is on the third floor in a very quiet street.
It is fully equipped and furnished for your convenience. Two balconies with the street .
Safe and guarded area. The building has a concierge.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the famous Barrio de Las Letras, or Las Cortes (by the name of the Congress of Deputies), stately and quiet, in the heart of Madrid.
It is the area with the most literary history, and with special charm and offers a thousand ways to enjoy the Spanish culture and its way of life.
You can enjoy a stroll around the area where the great classic Spanish writers such as Cervantes or Lope de Vega lived, and where you can read fragments of their works written on the streets.
You will also be close to the most famous and important museums (200 meters from the Prado Museum and Thyssen Museum, 500 meters from the Reina Sofia Museum), Caixa Forum.
It is just a few steps from the famous Plaza Santa Ana, La Plaza del Ángel,
huertas Street and Prado Street and 5 minutes from Puerta del Sol, kilometer 0 of the capital.
The Plaza de Santa Ana is the soul of the neighborhood where the well-known Spanish Theater is located, and many cafes, breweries and terra
host_about:
Estoy encantada de hospedar a gente de diferentes culturas y países, e intentaré que se sientan como en su casa. 
Yo misma comparto la nacionalidad española con la de México, país donde nací y pasé mi infancia y parte de mi juventud.
He convivido con maravillosas familias norteamericanas y canadienses, a través de intercambios juveniles, y con ellas aprendí la importancia de conocer  las diferentes culturas que enriquecen nuestras vidas y nos hacen tolerantes y abiertos a las diferencias.
Más tarde, por razones laborales he residido varios años en Bélgica y viajado por la mayor parte de los países europeos, y varias naciones asiáticas y africanas que me permitieron conocer a personas de las que conservo los mejores recuerdos.

name: Studio with terrace gym and coworking
description: This ground floor flat has a large private terrace. It is part of the General Margallo building of Home Club where all flats have access to a number of communal areas such as a gym, cafeteria area, a communal area and coworking spaces. The flat is located in the excellent area of Cuzco. Situated in the north of the city, it is away from the hustle and bustle of central Madrid, but has excellent transport links around the capital.
neighborhood_overview:
Culture: This neighbourhood is known for Plaza Cuzco and its proximity to the Santiago Bernabeu stadium. There is also easy access to a variety of shops, offices and restaurants, as well as the Paseo de la Castellana, one of Madrid's main streets with more shops and places of interest. There are plenty of traditional neighbourhood tavernas and Irish pubs, as well as stylish bars and nightclubs.

Shopping: There are small shops and supermarkets for everyday shopping in the area. The Alcampo supermarket is 170 metres away; you can also visit La Garriga, a premium food shop with a tasting area for breakfast, snacks and meals.

Eating/Drinking: A couple of minutes from the flat there is a VIPs and a Starbucks. If you are looking for a good restaurant nearby, La Tahona or Sal Y Chili are two fantastic options.

name: Wide Skies Madrid apartment
description: Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, fully equipped apartment with a huge terrace, walking distance to most places of interest, including dozens of antique shops. In-person check-in and you can arrive in the morning. Check-out is 3 pm, negotiable. Sleeps up to 6 people. Great food stores and restaurants right on our street.  You can cook yourself or eat out. We are a few hundred meters from a modern sports center (gyms, 25-meter swimming pool, rooftop jogging track with a beautiful view of Madrid).
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in the very center of town. If you walk straight up our street, in about 7 minutes you will reach the Plaza Mayor. Walking 5 minutes in the opposite direction will take you to the San Franciso el Grande church with marvelous paintings, including by Goya. Royal Palace is about 9 minutes walk.
The Rastro, the largest flea market in Europe, in operation since the Middle Ages, starts two short block away from our door. It is operating every Sunday from 9 am to 3 pm, with some 3000 stalls where you can buy things new and old.
On weekdays, the same area is an antique hunter’s paradise. It is rather sleepy and half empty, but there are probably more than 100 antique stores within a very short walk. They open around 10 – 10:30 am. Go to Calle de la Ribera de Curtidores, which is parallel to our street. This is the main antiques street, there are shops every few meters and some courtyards with additional shops. And virtually all side streets off the Ribera de Curtidor
host_about: A Polish woman, married to an American, living and working in New York, and missing Madrid, my favorite city on the planet. The apartment on Calle Toledo is our second home and, with the August 2015 end of its complete remodeling, is  a life-long dream come true. One day we may move there full time, but for now since we have active professional lives (Ren, a writer, me working in international relations) we decided to share the place with others when we are not there. Friends in Madrid are taking care of the logistics side for our guests. We hope you will love the place. Between the two of us, we can correspond in English, Spanish, Polish and French.  In a pinch, our daughter can help with Swahili, Dutch and Acholi.

name: Habitación en ático en Retiro-Atocha (women only)
description:
The room is in a nice penthouse with a big terrace. It's in a quite street.
Close to the main museums, Retiro Park (10 m. walk), Goya shopping area (3 metro stops).
From Atocha train station ( No 10 m. walk), you can take a direct train or bus to the airport.
The bathroom is shared with me, so only reservations by women are accepted for intimacy reasons.
No TV. No Wi-Fi . No air conditioning.
Please, do not smoke in the house.
I'd appreciate that you do not cook.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quite area and just a few minutes walking to the nicest places in the city: Retiro Park, Prado Museum, Atocha Station.
You can walk 20 min to Puerta del Sol or you can take the metro and you'll be in Plaza Mayor or the main shopping area Goya in 15 minutes.

There're plenty of restaurants and supermarkets around.

Direct connection to Madrid Airport from Atocha Station (10 min. walk). Train and buses nearby can take you to Segovia, El Escorial, Toledo...

I'll be happy to help you finding the best places in Madrid and surrounding areas according to your interests!

24h parking just around the corner.

If you want to take the metro during your stay in Madrid, you'll need to buy a transportation card (2'50 eur) to charge it. You can sell it to me when you leave.
host_about:
Soy bastante hogareña, pero mi afición favorita es viajar, así que cuando viajo me encanta sentirme como en casa y cuidarla como si fuera mía.
La gastronomía y la naturaleza, las costumbres diversas y la aventura es sobre todo lo que me empuja a viajar sin parar.

Empecé como anfitriona porque me encanta mi ciudad y que la gente la disfrute. Soy muy independiente, pero siempre disponible para ayudar.

Sígueme en @MCarmenMBR

name: Apartment near Madrid Gran Via
description: Modern and bright apartment located near Madrid's most famous street, Gran Vía. It is equipped for 4 people (1 double bed and 1 sofa bed) and ideal for groups of friends or families. Wifi and washing machine are also included. Linens and towels will be provided. For more information do not hesitate to read the detailed description below. :)
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the Malasaña district. Bubbling with life at any time of day – and often long into the night – Malasaña is Madrid’s hippest neighbourhood. From stunning architecture to hip little bars and restaurants, the district is overflowing with things to do and see. Surrounding Plaza del 2 de Mayo and near the Tribunal Metro stop, the trendy barrio is just minutes from Sol and a short walk to the most sought after museums and cultural hotspots. The district counts Madrid’s Gran Vía, also known as the "Madrid Broadway". It is one of the most memorable spaces to walk around the city and meet a large number of restaurants, cafes, theaters, cinemas and above all: fashion stores.
The nearest supermarket is at a 6-minute walk.

Places to visit:

- Puerta del Sol.
- Museo de Historia de Madrid.
- Parque del Buen Retiro.
- Plaza de Chueca.
- Plaza Dos de Mayo.
- Centro Cultural Conde Duque.

To do:

- Wal
host_about:
Dear future guests,

I love travelling, so I’m often absent. For me, the best way to get to know a city is by living there like a local person, and this can only be done, of course, by getting accommodation. It is with this in mind that whenever I am travelling, I make my lodging facility available to travelers from around the world, so: why not you?

Don’t worry, even if I’m not present when you are doing the booking arrangement, Luckey, Airbnb’s official concierge, to whom I have entrusted the management of my home, will make your stay as enjoyable as possible!

See you soon,

José Manuel. 

Estimados futuros huéspedes,

Me encanta viajar, así que a menudo estoy ausente. Para mí, la mejor manera de conocer una ciudad es viviendo allí como una persona local, y esto solo se puede hacer, por supuesto, obteniendo alojamiento. Es con esto en mente que cada vez que viajo, pongo mi alojamiento a disposición de viajeros de todo el mundo, entonces: ¿por qué no usted?

No se preocupe, incluso si no estoy presente cuando están haciendo el acuerdo de reserva, Luckey, el conserje oficial de Airbnb, a quien he confiado la administración de mi hogar, hará que su estadía sea lo más agradable posible.

Le veo pronto,

José Manuel.

description:
Magnificent flat of 120 m2 recently refurbished, with capacity for up to 6 people.
The flat is exterior and very bright.

neighborhood_overview:
Barrio Conde de Casal is a residential and commercial neighbourhood located in the Retiro district, in the centre of Madrid. It is a quiet neighbourhood and well connected to the rest of the city, thanks to the presence of several metro and bus lines.

In terms of architecture, the neighbourhood has residential buildings in a classical style, such as those found in the nearby Calle de Alcalá, as well as more modern and functional buildings.

It is also a commercial neighbourhood, with shops and services of all kinds, from supermarkets and grocery shops to clothes shops and restaurants.

The Conde de Casal neighbourhood also has several green spaces and recreational areas, such as the Retiro Park, which is just a few minutes' walk away. In addition, its central location makes it an excellent choice for those wishing to explore the historic centre of Madrid and its tourist attractions, such as the Prado Museum, Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor.
host_about:
you cannot always control what goes on outside.
But you can always control what goes on inside.

name: At Home in Madrid I, Centro, Prado, Barrio Letras
description:
Best location, right in the heart of Madrid! In the famous "Barrio de las Letras" - the literary neighborhood. Beautiful, clean apartment with lots of light in a historic building with elevator. Centrally-located with short walking distance (<10 mins) to all the major museums, Plaza Mayor, Royal Place, Puerta del Sol, Gran Via, Parque del Retiro, Atocha train station, etc.

You will love the apartment and our location!
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartment is in the Literary Neighborhood. El Barrio de las Letras. Home of Cervantes, Lope de Vega and Quevedo. Calle de Huertas, our street, is very popular and you can read poems written right on the street, as soon as you walk out of your home in Madrid. We are surrounded by lots of great restaurants. Right by plaza de Santa Ana and Plaza del Angel. Walking distance from Plaza del Sol, Plaza Mayor. You can also walk to Atocha Train station. From where you can take the AVE to Barcelona, Sevilla, Cordoba and many other cities of Spain. You can also take day trips to Toledo or Segovia.
Perfect Location!
host_about: I have lived in Madrid with my family since 2000. We travel a lot and like to stay at apartments ourselves. It makes you feel like you live in that city. I have set up my apartments with the idea that people would feel at home while they are in Madrid. It's their home away from home. I speak several languages and enjoy meeting people from all over the world. It will be my pleasure to host you in Madrid.

name: Artist Penthouse Oasis in the heart of Madrid
description:
Hi, my name is Helena.
I love taking care of my guests. Madrid is my city and my wish is that when you finish your trip you will be wanting to come back. Our apartment is a spacious & very unique one, in the center of Madrid. Walking proximity to most famous sights & attractions: Royal Palace, Prado Museum. Once the residence of a famous Cuban painter, now beautifully furnished to the highest standard with antique pieces. The silence inside will make you doubt you are in the center of the city
neighborhood_overview:
Calle del Olmo is a small and ancient road in the neighborhood of Ambassadors of the Centro district of Madrid, up from the street of Santa Isabel to Street Olivar (which then continues at Calvario to Jesus y Maria). Calle Olmo had a great tradition as an enclave of residents of Madrid's showbiz (la farándula) at the end of nineteenth and beginning of twentieth century. Although it pertains to the neighborhood of Ambassadors, it is just in the limits to the neighborhood of Las Letras which starts just across the Atocha Street.
Both Museo del Prado and Museo Reina Sofía as well as other important attractions like Botanic Garden, Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor are just a short 10-15 minute walk away. Others like the Royal Palace and Parque del Retiro are maybe 20 minute away.

description: Hemnes room designed with traditional and mordern furniture in a renovated centrally located 100m2 apartment with direct access to Barajas Airport, Atocha Central Train Station and Mendez Álvaro Sur Bus Station, as well as Sol and Museo del Prado.
neighborhood_overview:
Mostly residential area away from the noisy night drunks, though there are also bars and restaurants around the neighborhood as well as cheap supermarkets and fruit shops. It is also a safe area to hang out at night.

If you are interested in art, the famous Reina Sofia museum is within walking distance, and if you enjoy walking like us, you can also walk to Museo del Prado and other art galleries.
host_about:
I'm a designer, a photographer, a modern nomad. I live with less and work from anywhere in the world. So far it has been 8 cities in 3 continents and counting! 

Though I'm a digital designer by profession, I love interior design and took the chance to renovate my mother's decades-old apartment during a trip back so she could live more comfortably. As you can imagine it wasn't an easy task, try telling your parents to throw that old clock stuck at ten to eleven or that weird looking boat that's supposed to bring luck into the family. But we worked out something in the end and I got to take down some walls, placed a new floor that keeps the house super cool in summer, and basically changed all the furniture in the house. 

That boat stayed on though. ;P

My mother is based in Madrid and has been working as a local tour guide for VIP groups from Asian countries and brings them all over Spain, sometimes even to Morocco, Portugal and France. Though tiring she loves her job and meeting people. My sister and I don't stay in Spain normally so she's happy to have company with at the apartment if she's not away on tour.

If you book with us please take care of the house and treat it as your own. I have prepared a guide to give you an overview of the city. If we are at home we'll be happy to help you with planning so you make the most of your stay in the city :)

Cultura: Este barrio es conocido por la Plaza Cuzco y su proximidad al estadio Santiago Bernabéu. También hay fácil acceso a una variedad de tiendas, oficinas y restaurantes, así como al Paseo de la Castellana, una de las principales calles de Madrid, con más tiendas y lugares de interés. Hay un montón de tabernas tradicionales de barrio y pubs irlandeses, además de elegantes bares y discotecas.

Compras: Hay pequeñas tiendas y supermercados para la compra diaria en la zona. El supermercado Alcampo se encuentra a 170 metros; también puedes visitar La Garriga, una tienda de alimentos de primera calidad con espacio de degustación para desayunos, snacks y comidas.

Comer/ Beber: A un par de minutos del apartamento hay un VIPs y un Starbucks. Si buscan un buen restaurante cercano, La Tahona o Sal Y Chili son dos fantásticas opciones.

name: Central Garden Themed Room near Metro & Museums
description: Beautifully garden themed room in a renovated centrally located 100m2 apartment with direct access to Barajas Airport, Atocha Central Train Station and Mendez Álvaro Sur Bus Station, as well as Sol and Museo del Prado.
neighborhood_overview: Mostly residential area away from the noisy night drunks. There are also bars and restaurants around the neighborhood as well as cheaper supermarkets and fruit shops than the center. If you love museums, the famous Reina Sofia museum is within walking distance.
host_about:
I'm a designer, a photographer, a modern nomad. I live with less and work from anywhere in the world. So far it has been 8 cities in 3 continents and counting! 

Though I'm a digital designer by profession, I love interior design and took the chance to renovate my mother's decades-old apartment during a trip back so she could live more comfortably. As you can imagine it wasn't an easy task, try telling your parents to throw that old clock stuck at ten to eleven or that weird looking boat that's supposed to bring luck into the family. But we worked out something in the end and I got to take down some walls, placed a new floor that keeps the house super cool in summer, and basically changed all the furniture in the house. 

That boat stayed on though. ;P

My mother is based in Madrid and has been working as a local tour guide for VIP groups from Asian countries and brings them all over Spain, sometimes even to Morocco, Portugal and France. Though tiring she loves her job and meeting people. My sister and I don't stay in Spain normally so she's happy to have company with at the apartment if she's not away on tour.

If you book with us please take care of the house and treat it as your own. I have prepared a guide to give you an overview of the city. If we are at home we'll be happy to help you with planning so you make the most of your stay in the city :)

neighborhood_overview:
The Chamberí district was the area of ​​residence for a large part of the aristocracy of the 19th and 20th centuries.
Chamberí houses the Sorolla Museum and the Geomining Museum. The first is located in the house where the Valencian painter lived and, apart from the exhibition of his paintings, a visit to its facilities allows you to enjoy its valuable collections of sculptures, furniture and ceramics, as well as its fantastic garden.
Not far away is Andén Cero - Chamberí Station, an old metro station, closed in 1969, and which has been rehabilitated to become an interpretation center for the Madrid Metro. It allows us to go back to Madrid in 1919, the year in which the first subway line was inaugurated that crossed the center of the city from Cuatro Caminos to Gran Vía.
Another historical point is the Plaza de Olavide, in Trafalgar, a cozy garden square with many terraces, a regular meeting place for tapas.
Straddling the neighborhoods of Arapiles and Vallehermoso,

neighborhood_overview:
Transport: Tetuán and Cuzco metro stations are a 5-minute walk away.

Culture: This neighbourhood is known for Plaza Cuzco and its proximity to the Santiago Bernabeu stadium. There is also easy access to a variety of shops, offices and restaurants, as well as the Paseo de la Castellana, one of Madrid's main streets, with more shops and places of interest. There are plenty of traditional neighbourhood tavernas and Irish pubs, as well as stylish bars and nightclubs.

Shopping: There are small shops and supermarkets for everyday shopping in the area. The Alcampo supermarket is 170 metres away; you can also visit La Garriga, a premium food shop with a tasting area for breakfast, snacks and meals.

Eating/drinking: A couple of minutes from the flat there is a VIPs and a Starbucks. If you're looking for a good restaurant nearby, La Tahona or Sal Y Chili are two fantastic options.

We are right between Goya and Fuente del Berro and I'll explain why this is a plus:

Goya is an iconic neighborhood of Madrid that combines classic elegance with modern vibrancy. Here, you'll find a perfect mix of luxury boutiques, first-class restaurants, and a wide cultural offer. The famous “Wizink Center” is just a short walk away, making it the ideal spot if you plan on attending concerts or sporting events.

But Goya isn't just about shopping and entertainment. It is also home to beautiful parks and green areas, such as Eva Duarte de Perón Park, where you can enjoy pleasant walks and outdoor activities.

The central location of Goya makes it easy to access other parts of Madrid thanks to the nearby metro stops of Goya and Manuel Becerra as well as various bus stops. We invite you to explore this vibrant neighborhood and discover all it has to offer.

There´s also easy access to a variety of shops, offices, and restaurants as well as Paseo de la Castellana, a major street in Madrid, with more shops and landmarks. There are plenty of traditional barrio taverns and Irish pubs, alongside chic cocktail lounges and clubs.

Shopping: There are small shops and supermarkets for daily shopping in the area. Alcampo supermarket 170 meters away; or La Garriga, a premium food store with a small dining area for breakfast, snacks and meals.

Food/Drink: There are many great restaurants for casual or fine dining in the area. Additionally, there are many cocktail bars and cafes nearby that you can walk to.
